intro: Humularia lundaensis, commonly known as the Lunda humularia, is a flowering plant native to central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
